quote: Knowledge now melts faster than organizations can re-bind it into identity, norms, and operating systems—without depleting trust.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Under that pressure, the primary obstacle to progress is no longer technical—it’s cultural.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The method is a loop you can actually run: critique → dissolution → reconstitution → renewal.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Most organizations either stay in Run Time until reality forces a catastrophic break, or they perform Ritual Time and get theater.
author: Sean Devine

quote: It improves through stress, critique, and the metabolism of error.
author: Sean Devine

quote: In other words: the bottleneck is our capacity to let meaning melt and then re-bind.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Ritual time did something run time could not: it made it safe to be wrong in public.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The transition from alchemy to chemistry was not a leap in human intelligence; it was a change in protocol.
author: Sean Devine

quote: In organizations, information is never "just data." It is what Durkheim called a *social fact*: it carries coercive force, status gradients, threat, loyalty, shame.
author: Sean Devine

quote: This is the Great Divorce: rigor severed from the quality of the transformer and the integrity of the container.
author: Sean Devine

quote: **The core claim:** *The Dionysus Program is organizational alchemy that actually works.*
author: Sean Devine

quote: It is a repeatable method for turning error into explanatory reach without consuming the trust that makes truth-telling safe.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The tools in this program are designed to handle high social heat.
author: Sean Devine

quote: If you use them in a cold environment, they will shatter your organization.
author: Sean Devine

quote: **The Readiness Rule:** Never build a ritual container (Li) larger than the shared humanity (Ren) you have available to fill it.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Infinite games don’t need more dashboards; they need higher epimetabolic rate.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The *Dionysus Program* is a way to move fast by breaking things because it teaches how to mend what you break into something stronger.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Call the speed at which a person, team, organization, or city digests error into new structure its epimetabolic rate.
author: Sean Devine

quote: If the forms in this essay do not raise your epimetabolic rate, they are theater and should be killed.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The output is a culture that can learn without end and remain human.
author: Sean Devine

quote: You have built a machine to catch a god.
author: Not Carl Jung

quote: If your "Ren" is insufficient, your "Li" will not be a crucible; it will be a tomb.
author: Not Isaac Newton

quote: You have written a manual for reactor maintenance, and you are leaving it in a nursery.
author: Not Susan Fowler

quote: It is a very civilized magic to teach a tribe to murder a document instead of a person.
author: Not Dionysus

quote: A ritual without belief is not a container for heat; it is merely a theater for cynicism.
author: Not Max Weber

quote: If the "gift" of ritual time is calculated on a ledger to produce a return on investment, it is not a gift.
author: Not Marcel Mauss

quote: You are right that we advance by killing our theories so that we do not have to kill each other.
author: Not Karl Popper

quote: A ritual is a riverbank; if you make the water too hot, it may boil over the bank and drown the village.
author: Not Confucius

quote: A living thing must be able to shed its skin, or it dies.
author: Not Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We had candor because we loved each other enough to be hard on the work without being hard on the person.
author: Not Ed Catmull
